title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Generation (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: You are getting a link with self-interview arrangement. You have to record yourself, answering questions. Very cold and unhuman process. I don't know the next level as I was rejected.
Interview Questions: What is your view of the safeguarding policy.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Generation
Interview Descriptions: It was straight forward and not hard. I was asked what I would consider when teaching adults, difference between facilitating and training and I did a practical where I prepare for and taught a session
Interview Questions: A practical question where I simulated a real classroom and taught

title: Proyect Manager Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Generation (Ciudad de Mexico) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Todo marchó bien, muy amables las personas con las que me entrevisté, fueron muy transaparentes en el proceso, y constantemente te notificaban sobre el status del proceso de selección (se agredece).
Interview Questions: ¿Redes sociales favoritas? ¿Que inovarias en redes sociales? Tu experiencia profesional Hablar en inglés

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Generation
Interview Descriptions: First there is the HR Screening interview, then a performance task to assess different skills. If passed, there is an interview with the team lead followed by interviews with at least 2 other function leads
Interview Questions: How does your experience relate to this particular job? What are some of your strengths that make you a good fit? What is your preferred working style?

title: Employer Partnerships Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Generation (New York, NY) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: I attended several rounds of interview with reporting manager and leadership personnel. The interviewers were experienced and took upon themselves to clarify the role and expectations. Overall, the team is mission driven and supportive of one’s learning curve upon joining the team.
Interview Questions: What would you like to see if a team during challenging period?

title: Stagista Studente Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Generation (Naples) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Colloquio professionale in fase di selezione con più selezionatori. Cordialità e disponibilità da parte di quest'ultimi ad ogni dubbio riguardo il corso di cyber sicurezza di sistemi d'azienda.Creata nel 2015 da McKinsey & Company, l’organizzazione internazionale no-profit Generation contribuisce a ridurre la disoccupazione giovanile
Interview Questions: Come immagini la tua posizione fra 5 anni?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Generation (Mountain Home, AR) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Firstly you may receive 2 written tests, which ask you to write a project summary and draft an invitation email. If your tests passed, you will get the first round interview, you will meet the team lead, who will ask you based on your resume, and give examples of your experience. Then, you will see the head and ask you more challenging questions.
Interview Questions: introduce yourself use an animal to describe yourself explain your resume description what did you do in the past job

title: Grants Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Generation (Nairobi) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: I did a total of 4 interviews (3 oral & 1 written) with this organisation and was ghosted after the fourth. No feedback despite follow up. I initially applied for a Partnerships Associate role but was called in for a Grants Manager role which I was also fine with as had the relevant experience. The interviews were quite repetitive & therefore unnecessarily more than they should have been. I got a sense of poor internal coordination. One interview was cancelled at the last minute and therefore I had to create more time for another session. I was called for one without any prior notification and they expected me to do it on the same day. I also got a sense of lack of clarity as to what they were looking for in the role/person.  The questions were also quite probing in an almost personal way. While I believe in this organisation's mission, I think they can do more towards improving the way in which they conduct the recruitment process & treat the interviewee with some dignity. Given they work in employment related issues, they should be leading by example.
Interview Questions: Analysis of data on an Excel sheet

title: Pessoa Mentora Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Generation (São Paulo, São Paulo) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Foi muito simples, legal e intuitivo. É como um bate-papo entre você e o entrevistador, cria um ambiente confortável onde você sequer sente que está sendo entrevistado. Experiência muito legal, todas as entrevistas deveriam ser assim.
Interview Questions: O que você acha que define mentoria?

title: Canvas LMS Design Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Generation
Interview Descriptions: I had a short screening phone call and then a Zoom meeting in which I was asked to do a task related to the job.  It was adding and manipulating content in Canvas LMS.
Interview Questions: Why did I apply for this position.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Generation
Interview Descriptions: Very fair and friendly, they were prompt and updating us on every stage of the process. They asked you about your background and why you choose their company. Overall experience was really good.
Interview Questions: Why I have chosen their company.

title: Global Team Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Generation
Interview Descriptions: The process was very lengthy and I went 2-3 weeks at a time without hearing any updates from the team. During the final conversation, the hiring manager offered me a salary that was not previously approved and had to walk that back a day later. Very unorganized and all over the place
Interview Questions: Was asked a lot of questions about my interest in the role.

title: Specialist Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Generation (Sydney) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
An initial telephone call for clarity. 
An invitation to do a video-recorded interview with hireview (one way)
A zoom interview with two key people. Included an opportunity to provide a short live workshop to showcase facilitation skills.
Interview Questions:
The usual questions posed to facilitators about how to handle a group, and particularly the specialist group that the role was for. 
Highly recommend the ethics and personalities of the interviewers. It was excellent.

title: Global Compliance Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Generation (New York, NY) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
A recruiter reached out to me on LinkedIn asking about my interest in the role. I researched the organization and was very impressed. It started with a discussion with the recruiter, and then with the manager. 

I was sad not to have gotten the offer but glad to hear about such a wonderful organization.
Interview Questions: One of the questions had to do with how I would do directing a global compliance role as I had not done that before.

title: Global Learning Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Generation
Interview Descriptions: Long and demeaning. I received no communication for weeks after being told I had advanced to the third round after completing two excessively long tasks. Once I finally scheduled my third interview it was abundantly clear it was simply lip service.
Interview Questions: Describe your ideal work environment?

title: Data Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Generation
Interview Descriptions:
It's interesting there are 3 negative interviews for a similar role over the course of a year.    Did not make it past the first stage, but it seemed exhaustive.  I was told there would be an interview with a hiring manager next then panel then executive.  

Another review mentions there was an assessment.  That was not mentioned in my interview process.  I feel i got a glimpse into the dysfunction when the the interviewer mentioned he was recently moved into Talent and folks were shuffled around.

I was offered no feedback.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to Generation?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Generation in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: There were 4 rounds of interviews. First with the CEO, second with the Program Manager, then with the COO and CEO of the Asia Pacific region. It was not that difficult if you are passionate about bridging the gap between education and employment.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Your experience. Program planning experience and knowledge

title: Curriculum Design Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Generation (Madrid)
Interview Descriptions: I received an email a month after my application asking me to do a test. I had to write two modules. I sent it back and never heard from them ever again.
Interview Questions: Nunca hubo una entrevista, solo me pidieron escribir dos modulos de aprendizaje .

title: Pessoa Assistente de Jornada Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Generation in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: O processo seletivo durou um mês mais ou menos e durante todo o momento a equipe foi muito atenciosa comigo. Mesmo sem muita experiência na época me tranquilizaram que haveria treinamentos e orientações sobre as aulas e como lidar com estudantes e todas as promessas foram cumpridas.
Interview Questions: Como lidaria com um episódio de assédio durante a aula ao vivo?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Generation
Interview Descriptions:
please please please do not apply to these guys they will take their ideas and use them as their own, which is a bit entertaining since they are McKinsey execs, I thought they'd be smart enough to create their own ideas.

Their interview process involves you doing a task for them, they will then invite you for an interview and quickly reject you, they live their easy life and get promoted on your back! 

It's shameful, but technically legal because your work is "open source" you see.

These (senior members) are running a racket for free work and should be thoroughly ashamed of themselves, this experience has involved the UK branch.
Interview Questions: any extra details, they want to know, just so when they show it to their  boss it looks like their own idea. Your their free consultant, you see :)

title: Global Alumni Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Generation (Washington, DC) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was an absolute waste of time. I went through 4 or 5 rounds with various members of different teams and all were basically a copy and paste of the previous one. The interview process involved two long and detailed tasks, which was essentially idea mining because they wanted me to plan out their strat plan for them. They also wanted to interview a reference via zoom as part of the interview process. After being told consistently that I was in the 'final two' they continuously pushed back deadlines on telling me I had gotten the position or not-- and I mean this went on for two and a half months. It's obvious to me now they were stringing me along, which is cruel considering I was applying during the height of the pandemic when there were limited positions across orgs. I could have given my time and energy to another organization and I wish I had.
Interview Questions: Regular interview questions. Nothing too hard.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Generation (Washington, DC) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and it took about 4 weeks until I got an email for an HR Screen. After the HR screen, I waited for 2 months and followed up 4 times. I was told to provide time slots for a second stage interview (in April 2020) but I'm still waiting for a response. It's been 3 months now and I haven't heard back.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable working with people of different cultures and backgrounds?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Generation (São Paulo, São Paulo)
Interview Descriptions: Fui notificado da aprovação na primeira fase, logo após fiz uma entrevista com um recrutador online. Logo após, aprovado nessa fase, fiz uma entrevista com o CEO da Generation. A entrevista foi interessante, com perguntas relevantes e houve uma explicação justa da função. Logo após, também aprovado, fiz uma entrevista com a McKinsey, onde a entrevistadora, sem nenhuma educação ou tato, me deu um case (quase) absurdo de resolver e sem pé nem cabeça, que nada tinha a ver com a vaga. Logo após, não tive nenhum feedback, nem positivo, nem negativo. Isso já faz mais de 8 meses.
Interview Questions: Conte-me sobre sua experiência com educação

title: Global Instruction Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Generation
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, the interview process took over two months, with multiple hiring tasks and delayed responses. It was incredibly disrespectful and demoralizing. I first had a positive phone screening, but was told to wait until I would know next steps. I then was asked for a work sample followed by two tasks which each took 2-3 hours. From there,  I waited over a month for another round interview. At that point I was told to wait another two weeks for feedback. After that, I received a generic rejection letter over email.
Interview Questions: Describe your ideal working conditions

title: Freelance Curriculum Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Generation in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Short 15 min interview; questions were more logistical questions than any background or experience questions. Then the next step asks you to complete a sample task which was a lesson plan in their format and curriculum concepts -- which took about 2.5 hours to complete! I heard back I didn't move on an hour after submitting -- did you even look at it?!?

Too much work for little interaction.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the organization?
